project.teaser: The current paradigm for battery testing is fragmented, time-consuming, and expensive. To fully characterize the performance of a battery cell requires a wide variety of both destructive and non-destructive tests, some of which can last for months or years. A new paradigm for...
project.objective: The current paradigm for battery testing is fragmented, time-consuming, and expensive. To fully characterize the performance of a battery cell requires a wide variety of both destructive and non-destructive tests, some of which can last for months or years. A new paradigm for battery testing is needed that takes full advantage of the latest advances in automation, data science, and modelling to bring battery development firmly into the digital era. DigiBatt will slingshot the European battery industry forward by developing novel digital approaches to extract more value from fewer tests. This will save valuable time and resources in a highly competitive industry. DigiBatt has assembled a consortium representing some of the world's leading battery research institutions, Gigafactories, and integrators, and will apply recent advances in autonomous battery testing, model-based simulation, and data-driven semantics to promote digital battery testing from TRL 4 to TRL 6.
project.title: DIGITAL SOLUTIONS FOR ACCELERATED BATTERY TESTING
project.keywords: Battery, Battery testing, Digitalisation, Digital twin, FAIR data

article.title: Innovative digital solutions for fast battery testing

result.title: Report on computational framework for non-invasive parameterisation
result.description: Report on algorithms for Bayesian inference combined with physics-based models for non-invasive parametrization of battery cells. This is linked to task 5.1 and will be used in subsequent work in the project.

result.title: Development of computational framework for non-invasive parameterization of physics-based models

details.authors: Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt e. V. (DLR); SINTEF Industry; Forschungszentrum Jülich

result.title: Revised data management plan
result.description: Updated plan for how to handle data generated in the project. This will be made available to all participants to ensure consistent standards throughout the project.This deliverable is associated with task 1.3.

result.title: Reduced order cell models for lifetime assessment
result.description: Simplified simulation models for accelerated lifetime assessment. This is linked to taks 6.1 and will be used throughout the project.

result.title: Initial plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: Initial plan for dissemination, exploitation and communication activities. This will be followed and reviewed at regular intervals. This deliverable is associated with task 1.4.

result.title: Innovation and exploitation plan
result.description: Plan for innovation and exploitation specific to creating impact in industry. This deliverable is associated with task 1.4.

result.title: DigiBatt Project Handbook and Risk Management Table
Digital twin framework
result.description: Open source framework for battery cell digital twin. This is associated with task 3.1 and will be used throughout the project.

result.title: Battery pack upscaling and use-case report
result.description: Report on upscaling of the cell level digital twins to battery pack level for specific use-cases. This is linked to task 7.1 and will be used in subsequent work packages.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: Plan for how to handle data generated in the project. This will be made available to all participants to ensure consistent standards throughout the project. This forms part of task 1.3.

result.title: Ageing and safety testing framework
result.description: Framework for reducing the cell number and test duration for ageing and safety test. This is linked to task 4.2 and will be used in subsequent work packages.

result.title: Virtual testing models
result.description: Prototype models with parameterization tools. This is linked to task 3.2 and will be used in subsequent work packages.

result.title: DigiBatt Initial plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
Application ontologies
result.description: Application ontologies and data models for battery testing. This deliverable is associated with task 2.1 and will be used in subsequent tasks in the WP.

result.title: Project handbook and risk management table.
result.description: Handbook with guidelines for project participants plus table of risks to project completion and mitigation measures.This will be distributed to project participants to ensure smooth running of the project and consistent standards from all partners. This deliverable is associated with task 1.2.

result.title: Physics‐Based Inverse Modeling of Battery Degradation with Bayesian Methods

details.authors: Micha C. J. Philipp, Yannick Kuhn, Arnulf Latz, Birger Horstmann

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
